name: llvm-amdgpu

variants.name: rocm-device-libs
variants.description: Build ROCm device libs as external LLVM project instead of a standalone spack package.

description:
Toolkit for the construction of highly optimized compilers, optimizers,
and run-time environments.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: z3
dependencies.description:
Z3 is a theorem prover from Microsoft Research. It is licensed under the
MIT license.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: ncurses
dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.

dependencies.name: perl-data-dumper
dependencies.description: Stringified perl data structures, suitable for both printing and eval

dependencies.name: hwloc
dependencies.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.

dependencies.name: libelf
dependencies.description:
libelf lets you read, modify or create ELF object files in an
architecture-independent way. The library takes care of size and endian
issues, e.g. you can process a file for SPARC processors on an Intel-
based system. Note: libelf is no longer maintained and packages that
depend on libelf should migrate to elfutils.

dependent_to.name: heffte
dependent_to.description: Highly Efficient FFT for Exascale

dependent_to.name: rocrand
dependent_to.description:
The rocRAND project provides functions that generate pseudo-random and
quasi-random numbers.

dependent_to.name: camp
dependent_to.description:
Compiler agnostic metaprogramming library providing concepts, type
operations and tuples for C++ and cuda

dependent_to.name: strumpack
dependent_to.description:
STRUMPACK -- STRUctured Matrix PACKage - provides linear solvers for
sparse matrices and for dense rank-structured matrices, i.e., matrices
that exhibit some kind of low-rank property. It provides a distributed
memory fully algebraic sparse solver and preconditioner. The
preconditioner is mostly aimed at large sparse linear systems which
result from the discretization of a partial differential equation, but
is not limited to any particular type of problem. STRUMPACK also
provides preconditioned GMRES and BiCGStab iterative solvers.

dependent_to.name: rocm-openmp-extras
dependent_to.description: OpenMP support for ROCm LLVM.

dependent_to.name: umpire
dependent_to.description:
An application-focused API for memory management on NUMA & GPU
architectures

dependent_to.name: hwloc
dependent_to.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.

dependent_to.name: libceed
dependent_to.description: The CEED API Library: Code for Efficient Extensible Discretizations.

dependent_to.name: aluminum
dependent_to.description:
Aluminum provides a generic interface to high-performance communication
libraries, with a focus on allreduce algorithms. Blocking and non-
blocking algorithms and GPU-aware algorithms are supported. Aluminum
also contains custom implementations of select algorithms to optimize
for certain situations.

dependent_to.name: petsc
dependent_to.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.

dependent_to.name: rocalution
dependent_to.description:
rocALUTION is a sparse linear algebra library with focus on exploring
fine-grained parallelism on top of AMD's Radeon Open eCosystem Platform
ROCm runtime and toolchains, targeting modern CPU and GPU platforms.
Based on C++ and HIP, it provides a portable, generic and flexible
design that allows seamless integration with other scientific software
packages.

dependent_to.name: chai
dependent_to.description: Copy-hiding array interface for data migration between memory spaces

dependent_to.name: mfem
dependent_to.description: Free, lightweight, scalable C++ library for finite element methods.

dependent_to.name: ceed
dependent_to.description:
Ceed is a collection of benchmarks, miniapps, software libraries and
APIs for efficient high-order finite element and spectral element
discretizations for exascale applications developed in the Department of
Energy (DOE) and partially supported by the Exascale Computing Project
(ECP). This is a Spack bundle package that installs the CEED software
components.

dependent_to.name: rocblas
dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute BLAS library

dependent_to.name: tasmanian
dependent_to.description:
The Toolkit for Adaptive Stochastic Modeling and Non-Intrusive
ApproximatioN is a robust library for high dimensional integration and
interpolation as well as parameter calibration.

dependent_to.name: rocprim
dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library

dependent_to.name: elpa
dependent_to.description: Eigenvalue solvers for Petaflop-Applications (ELPA)

dependent_to.name: amrex
dependent_to.description:
AMReX is a publicly available software framework designed for building
massively parallel block- structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR)
applications.

dependent_to.name: hydrogen
dependent_to.description:
Hydrogen: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra and
optimization library. Based on the Elemental library.

dependent_to.name: rocm-clang-ocl
dependent_to.description: OpenCL compilation with clang compiler

dependent_to.name: dbcsr
dependent_to.description: Distributed Block Compressed Sparse Row matrix library.

dependent_to.name: rocm-tensile
dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute Tensile library

dependent_to.name: migraphx
dependent_to.description: AMD's graph optimization engine.

dependent_to.name: hsa-rocr-dev
dependent_to.description:
This repository includes the user mode API nterfaces and libraries
necessary for host applications to launch computer kernels to available
HSA ROCm kernel agents.AMD Heterogeneous System Architecture HSA - Linux
HSA Runtime for Boltzmann (ROCm) platforms.

dependent_to.name: slate
dependent_to.description:
The Software for Linear Algebra Targeting Exascale (SLATE) project is to
provide fundamental dense linear algebra capabilities to the US
Department of Energy and to the high-performance computing (HPC)
community at large. To this end, SLATE will provide basic dense matrix
operations (e.g., matrix multiplication, rank-k update, triangular
solve), linear systems solvers, least square solvers, singular value and
eigenvalue solvers.

dependent_to.name: rocm-device-libs
dependent_to.description: set of AMD specific device-side language runtime libraries

dependent_to.name: kokkos
dependent_to.description:
Kokkos implements a programming model in C++ for writing performance
portable applications targeting all major HPC platforms.

dependent_to.name: hip
dependent_to.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.

dependent_to.name: blaspp
dependent_to.description:
C++ API for the Basic Linear Algebra Subroutines. Developed by the
Innovative Computing Laboratory at the University of Tennessee,
Knoxville.

dependent_to.name: care
dependent_to.description: Algorithms for chai managed arrays.

dependent_to.name: lbann
dependent_to.description:
LBANN: Livermore Big Artificial Neural Network Toolkit. A distributed
memory, HPC-optimized, model and data parallel training toolkit for deep
neural networks.

dependent_to.name: sundials
dependent_to.description:
SUNDIALS (SUite of Nonlinear and DIfferential/ALgebraic equation
Solvers)

dependent_to.name: ginkgo
dependent_to.description:
High-performance linear algebra library for manycore systems, with a
focus on sparse solution of linear systems.

dependent_to.name: dihydrogen
dependent_to.description:
DiHydrogen is the second version of the Hydrogen fork of the well-known
distributed linear algebra library, Elemental. DiHydrogen aims to be a
basic distributed multilinear algebra interface with a particular
emphasis on the needs of the distributed machine learning effort, LBANN.

dependent_to.name: comgr
dependent_to.description:
This provides various Lightning Compiler related services. It currently
contains one library, the Code Object Manager (Comgr)

dependent_to.name: raja
dependent_to.description: RAJA Parallel Framework.

dependent_to.name: magma
dependent_to.description:
The MAGMA project aims to develop a dense linear algebra library similar
to LAPACK but for heterogeneous/hybrid architectures, starting with
current "Multicore+GPU" systems.

dependent_to.name: hipify-clang
dependent_to.description:
hipify-clang is a clang-based tool for translation CUDA sources into HIP
sources

dependent_to.name: nekrs
dependent_to.description:
nekRS is an open-source Navier Stokes solver based on the spectral
element method targeting classical processors and hardware accelerators
like GPUs
